column4: I changed the IP address on my server and now apt-get update won't connnect, the moment I change it back to the old IP everything works fine... any help would be greatly appreciated
does anyone know why apt-get won't connect after just changing the IP address of the server?
no it's setup at work
I'm running ubuntu server 11.10 on it
physical
all i did was edit the interfaces file and change the IP address and now apt-get update fails to connect every time
yes I went from .45 to a .26
on a 10.x.x.x network
no as a matter of fact everybody can see the server just fine and I can also initiate connections out... but for some reason apt-get wont work
if i change the IP back to what it was everything works fine
do you have an apt-proxy set or something maybe?
paste the contents of /etc/apt/apt.conf  ?
I don't have that file but rather a directory for configuration
hmm, okay.  can you ping us.archive.ubuntu.com?
wget http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/project/ubuntu-archive-keyring.gpg
pastebin the output of "route -n"?
may as well do /etc/network/interfaces while you're there
pastebin
are you sure that the router is set to allow that IP out?
do you have /etc/network/interfaces both the working and non-working version?
all I can think of is that it's your router blocking it.  Sorry
not necessarily.  Depends how it's setup.  ICMP is different to TCP.  It might be allowing ICMP out but not TCP
